TRIBAL DEVELOPMENT THROUGH ORCHARD FARMING
PROMOTION OF FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATION

TDF – WADI is a orchard based livelihood improvement programme under NABARD exclusively meant for Tribal Households in a compact area. Under this project SVA has supported 1050 tribal households in Sinapali block to develop mango orchards in their uplands.

POPI which stands for Producer Organization Promoting Institution. NABARD has been providing financial assistance to NGOs Farmer Producer Organizations for which it is created a fund in the name of Producer Fund. The NGOs who are supported for this programme as knows as POPI.

ITC Limited is a Corporate house and SVA has received a grant from ITC under it’s Corporate Social Responsibility Fund for a rural development project in Ganjam district. Under this project SVA has constructed 50 percolation tanks and farm ponds and trained the farmers in improved agronomic practices, farm mechanization and crop diversification to address to the issue of climate change.

Government of Odisha has launched a programme to promote millet cultivation in tribal areas for which it has created a separate scheme with the name Odisha Millet Mission. This programme is being implanted involving several NGOs who are working at grass root level. The purpose is to improve food and nutrition security particularly among the tribal people of Odisha. SVA has been working with 3000 farmers in Sinapali and Narla blocks of Nuapada and Kalahandi districts respectively.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ABOUT SAMAJ O SANSKRUTI Samaj O Sanskruti, a socio-cultural organisation, is a humble craetion of few people of emminence from the field of art, social service, culture and music. The main objective of the Samaj O Sanskruti to promote, protect and propagate the rich cultural heritage, art, folk art, folk culture, rural culture, traditional music and create awareness among the people on different issues by using traditional form of music and dance. Samaj o sankruti organies unique programme Ei Aamari Gaon(this is our village) with an objective of the programme to revive the rich culture , tradition, custome and lokakatha which are now at the verge of extinction from the society and too to popularise it among the inhabitants of urban areas. unique effort of Samaj O Sanskruti to arrange such a beautiful programme, that reminds our origine and rich village culture. Prior to this programme competition is organised Zonal level and final ot the state level in Bhubaneswar, where the participant were requested to perform the song that carries essence and flavour of the village. Not only cultural programme but every year this year too Ishwar Chandra Sahitya Sammana was given to emminent writer, that is award every year in the name of emminent writer, administrator and Social worker Late Iswar Chandra Samal . From this year Samaj O Sanskruti decided to felicitate emminent persons from the field of social service, culture and industry in the memory of late Chandra Madhab Mishra, a legenday social activist, culture lover, industrialist and politician of the state. Apart from of the cultural and literary activities , Samaj O Sanskruti works for the social cause like Rakshya Bandhana in orphanage, distributing kambal to the street helpless and organised blood donation camp in the month of February in association with different social organisations. Samaj O Sanskruti organises awareness programme on different burning topics regularly . We in Samaj o Sanskruti help the brilliant students for there study and treatment with our little capacity. We too organise charity programmes to help the affected people of different natural calamities, The Organisation has a greater dream and has put its effort to open a Jaraashram (Old Age Home) to take care of the neglected senior citizens.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Our Program goals and purpose is ensuring sustainable livelihood of target families through agriculture and other self generating activities to raise their standard of living. Convert the dry land in to productive land by providing Irrigation Facilities and enhance Agricultural products for ensuring Sustainable Livelihood. To create job opportunities within the target area through skill Training, Industrial Training, Agricultural Inputs and organize marketing of the products by communities.

Samajik Seva Sadan believes in total sanitation in the district of Odisha and has taken initiative on sanitation program by Rural Water Sanitation Mission through sensitization and awareness and also worked on health and sanitation of their own. Communities planned for construction of latrines through involvement process and they are monitoring the execution work through Panchayat Samiti Office of District.

There are some impact by implementing this project like Income of many families have increased through Agriculture products. Quality of dry land increased cultivated seasonal crops and made more productive. Many Farmers are engaged in agriculture through out the year and regular income source have ensured. More over migration of this area have decreased as they earn at their own village. More Adivasi families have entered in to Entrepreneurship and control the price of Agriculture products.

Swatch Bharat Abhiyan Program is very much helpful for the grass root level communities through out this tribal belt. They are very much aware of this sanitation schemes. Odisha govt also very much helpful to fulfill the dream of Central Government.

In course of various inventions by other raises and finally by the Britishers totally took away their right to the land

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 45 Community Leaders and SHG members Capacity Building was done. Among them one SHG tribal woman became the Block Chairperson, One tribal woman became Sarpanch and 3 more as PRI leaders. Staff regularly visit all households to find their problem and provide health education and awareness on different topics. Proper distribution of water within the farmer field. Made the Diasil and other villagers to raise check dams for construction. Promotion and development of Agriculture Productivity is done in all 30 villages with the organic farming and compost pits. Horticultural Development is done with the cashew plantation and other fruit tree 60000 saplings were raised and distributed. Provide health services both mobile and clinic based. Treated 27568 patients in the five years by having mobile clinic and 2780 patients were treated in the SHED clinics. In the recent Cholera outbreak Toyaput clinic was one of the base clinics and treated more than 200 patients in that period. 250 biogas plants were erected and 10 masons were given biogas construction trainings. 76 biogas beneficiaries attended users training. 200 smokeless chulla were constructed to avoid heavy deforestation. Maintenance of hand pumps is done by enabling the villagers to contact the concerned department. Empowerment of Panchayati raj is done with periodic PRI and Block level meetings at Toyaput SHED campus. More than 26 trades vocational trainings were organized such as cycle repair, black smithy, sisal fibre products etc and 50% of them are now self employed. Enabled the community to get government schemes and to the tune of more than 7 crore worth of schemes were introduced in this area. 248 SHGs were promoted, supported in running their groups and enabled them to get necessary linkages. Women empowerment is done through the 25 different training programmes specially organsied for women. One Federation of SHGs is active in each project area All 258 SHGs could linked with banks for several times loan support for their income generation programmes to the tune of Rs. 90,00,000 in total. 130 Grain Seed Banks were promoted to store more than 15000KGs of grain seeds to avoid exploitation from middlemen and they are made self supportive in the cultivation seasons. All 210 villagers were given awareness on programmes NREGS, peopleâ€™s rights etc. Land Entitlement moves are made to get people to get land pattas. Involvement of Youth in the development work is done. The Nehru Youth Association could run a High School, Konapadi Youth Association could run a rice mill and dal processing unit. At Bogaipadar village sisal fibre product training was done and people could extract fibre and generated employment as per the local resources More than 120000 nursery seedlings were raised and distributed among the villagers. Community Based organizations such as Gramya Sanghas, Mahila Mandals, Yubak Sanghas, Village Forest Committees were formed and people were enabled to have their fruitful participation for village development. More than 900 Antenatal cases and 840 Post natal cases were given support and institutional deliveries at SHED Clinis as well as safe deliveries through trained Dais were provided. 730 Mosquito nets were distributed to the beneficiaries 2200 persons have adopted both temporary and permanent Family Planning methods. School health programmes were conducted regularly in seventeen schools. More than 150 children were dewormed and 150 cases of scabbies treatment were provided. Promoted TWO central Herbal garden Old age care was done at their home level and three cataract surgeries camps were organized by benefiting 55 old persons. Cultural Activities for effective awareness was organized in each village through Puppetry, Music and Songs in all 210 villages. Micro plan for village developments was done through PRA method in all 210 villages.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: our vision is to be an integral part in strengthening the peoples movement particularly from among the voiceless artists of grass root and to reach our culture all over India and abroad too. Our motto is to support the excluded and their arts. Our mission is to advocate the cause of the grass root level artists and their art. To organise interactive seminars and workshops among the theatre artistes and research scholars. Our organisation has been working in the field of art and culture through the medium of theatre since last 28 years to popularise and promote theatre and aware the mass through it. Our organisation has been participating various state as well as national level theatre festivals every year.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: One Women Self Help Group belonging to munda got recognition by the district administration of Keonjhar for exemplary work on potato cultivation (Nua sakala SHG of Nipania Village, G.P. Sunapentha, Block: Harichandanpur, Keonjhar, Odisha. Sucessfully continuing the SHG Bank linkage project of NABARD. All the families of Rohi micro watershed village belonging to primitive tribe have repaid all their past loans by cultivating tomato and potato (free from poverty trap). 15 tons of potato have been kept by the tribal SHGs in the cold storage at Keonjhar to use it as seed during this year. Vaccination of goats completed in 12 villages covering 6000 goats
